Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
pod
Not to be confused with {P.O.D.}.
1. <printer> (Allegedly from abbreviation POD for "Prince Of Darkness") A {Diablo} 630 (or, latterly, any {letter-quality} {impact printer}). From the {DEC-10} {PODTYPE} program used to feed formatted text to it.
2. <text> {Plain Old Documentation}.
[{Jargon File}]
(1998-12-18)

Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
P.O.D.
<data> Piece Of Data (as opposed to {code}).
[{Jargon File}]
(2000-04-08)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pod \Pod\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Podded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Podding}.] To swell; to fill; also, to produce pods. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: -pod \-pod\ [See {Foot}.] A combining form or suffix from Gr. poy`s, podo`s, foot; as, decapod, an animal having ten feet; phyllopod, an animal having leaflike feet; myriapod, hexapod. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pod \Pod\, n. [Probably akin to pudding, and perhaps the same word as pad a cushion; cf. also Dan. pude pillow, cushion, and also E. cod a husk, pod.] 1. A bag; a pouch. [Obs. or Prov. Eng.] --Tusser. [1913 Webster]
2. (Bot.) A capsule of plant, especially a legume; a dry dehiscent fruit. See Illust. of {Angiospermous}. [1913 Webster]
3. (Zo["o]l.) A considerable number of animals closely clustered together; -- said of seals. [1913 Webster]
{Pod auger}, or {pod bit}, an auger or bit the channel of which is straight instead of twisted. [1913 Webster]

pod n. [allegedly from abbreviation POD for `Prince Of Darkness'] A Diablo 630 (or, latterly, any letter-quality impact printer). From the DEC-10 PODTYPE program used to feed formatted text to it. Not to be confused with {P.O.D.}.
P.O.D. /P-O-D/ [rare] Acronym for `Piece Of Data' (as opposed to a code section). See also {pod}.

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)
Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: pod n 1: the vessel that contains the seeds of a plant (not the seeds themselves) [syn: {cod}, {seedcase}] 2: a several-seeded dehiscent fruit as e.g. of a leguminous plant [syn: {seedpod}] 3: a group of aquatic mammals 4: a detachable container of fuel on an airplane [syn: {fuel pod}] v 1: take something out of its shell or pod; "pod peas or beans" 2: produce pods, of plants [also: {podding}, {podded}]
